messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Roly Poly bugs
messages.msgSnippet: The little flattish, oval grey ones that have more than six legs?  Sow bugs.   Debi ... From: SandraDodd@aol.com To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com Sent:
messages.messageBody:
The little flattish, oval grey ones that have more than six legs? Sow bugs. Debi
----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, May 30, 2002 7:22 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Roly Poly bugs


What are the flat ones called that don't roll up?
We have lots in the compost.

The pill bugs ("sow bugs," my mom called them when I was little in Texas) are
fun, but these flat prehistoric slime eaters are not cute.

messages.messageBody:
What are the flat ones called that don't roll up?
We have lots in the compost.

The pill bugs ("sow bugs," my mom called them when I was little in Texas) are
fun, but these flat prehistoric slime eaters are not cute.

messages.subject: Roly Poly bugs
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/30/02 6:55:37 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/30/02 6:55:37 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Roly-poly bugs or Pill bugs (the ones that live in basements, under
porches
or any cool damp place. >>

We must have the biggest population of Roly Poly's I've ever seen here.
I thought we had quite a few in OR, but the place we live now beats it by far.
My dd collects and plays with them all the time, she even had a Roly Poly
terrarium for a while.
Ren
